subject: Problem with IDEA and the JUnit 4 Description hierarchy
msgSnippet: Hi all, We re developing a framework called JDave (http://www.laughingpanda.org/projects/jdave). In order to get IDE support from day-one, we decided to adapt
messageBody:
Hi all,

We're developing a framework called JDave
(http://www.laughingpanda.org/projects/jdave). In order to get IDE
support from day-one, we decided to adapt for JUnit. In the case of
JUnit 4, this translates to @RunWith and a custom Runner
implementation.

The problem I'm facing is that while Eclipse displays the hierarchy
correctly as a tree, IntelliJ IDEA doesn't play along quite as nicely.
Below are links to screenshots of what it looks like currently in
different IDEs:

Correct behavior in Eclipse:
http://tinyurl.com/36tzd3

Incorrect behavior in IDEA:
http://tinyurl.com/3xye2k

Correct behavior in IDEA:
http://tinyurl.com/2jzf5d
(using our Junit 3 integration, which works in both Eclipse and IDEA)

I believe I'm doing something wrong with how I build the Description
object in my custom runner but I can't find a "specification" to
verify my implementation against. I tried browsing the junit CVS and
couldn't find tests that would tell me about how one is supposed to
create those Description objects.

Here's an example of the kind of hierarchy we're creating currently:

jdave.junit4.StackSpec (suite:true, tests:8)
StackWhichIsNeitherEmptyNorFull (suite:true, tests:1)
addsToTheTopWhenSentPush (suite:false, tests:1)
FullStack (suite:true, tests:5)
isFull (suite:false, tests:1)
complainsOnPush (suite:false, tests:1)
containsAllItems (suite:false, tests:1)
doesNotContainRemovedItem (suite:false, tests:1)
containsAllButRemovedItem (suite:false, tests:1)
EmptyStack (suite:true, tests:2)
isEmpty (suite:false, tests:1)
isNoLongerEmptyAfterPush (suite:false, tests:1)

Any pointers as to where I'm falling off the Path of Righteousness?

Lasse
